medium: Mahogany with white oak and English (probably Birmingham) painted dial
title: Tall case clock
marks: Signature; Inscription inside door of case: [Carden Proctor, August 1773,
description: clock, long case; hood has scroll top and brass finial; painted domed dial framed by fluted columns with capitals and bases gilded; body framed by quarter round columns rests on feet in bracket form terminating in claw-and-ball and carved with acanthus; band of carved fretwork below dial
creditline: Gift of James F. and Louise H. Bell in memory of James S. and Sallie M. Bell
